docs.snippet: The scandal centers on claims that the Japanese government granted improper political favors, but connecting the dots any further may be difficult.

headline.print_headline: With a Fax, Trying to Link Japan’s Leader to a Scandal
headline.main: Fax-Wielding Witness Tries to Link Japan’s Prime Minister to Scandal

docs.snippet: Decorated with Serbian nationalist slogans and images, the train was stopped in a stunt that set off an escalation of tensions between former wartime foes.

headline.main: Serbian Nationalist Train Halts at Border With Kosovo

docs.snippet: A new exhibit at the Bronx Documentary Center looks at the many social justice movements whose supporters took to New York’s streets between 1980 and 2000.

headline.main: The Golden Era of New York Street Protests

docs.abstract: A new exhibit at the Bronx Documentary Center looks at the many social justice movements whose supporters took to New York’s streets between 1980 and 2000.

docs.snippet: James Harris Jackson, 28, an Army veteran from Baltimore claimed responsibility for using a sword to fatally stab a black man, the police say.

headline.print_headline: Manhattan Killing Suspect Hated Black Men, Police Say
headline.main: Suspect in Manhattan Killing Hated Black Men, Police Say

docs.snippet: A jury convicted the owner of the New England Compounding Center, blamed for an outbreak that killed 60, of racketeering charges but acquitted him of murder.

headline.print_headline: Acquittal of Murder Charges  After 60 Meningitis Deaths
headline.main: Compounding Pharmacy Owner Not Guilty of Murder After 60 Meningitis Deaths

docs.snippet: Likes? “Star Wars” and Donald J. Trump. The ever-so-contrary Silicon Valley billionaire discusses his way of looking differently at the world.

docs.snippet: She has been a fan of his ever since they met at Le Club in 1974. Now that he is president, her cheerleading has consequences.

headline.main: Nikki Haskell Learns the Social Cost of Supporting Donald Trump

docs.snippet: Iceland’s president told high school students that that pizza topped with pineapple should be outlawed. Fans of the topping were outraged.

headline.print_headline: Pineapple Pizza Tests Limits of Presidential Power in Iceland
headline.main: Pineapple Pizza Tests Limits of Presidential Power in Iceland

docs.snippet: From coverage of state-sanctioned killings of drug users in the Philippines to in-depth reports on Venezuela’s economic and social collapse, The New York Times swept the Overseas Press Club’s photography awards.

headline.main: The Times Sweeps Overseas Press Club Photo Awards

docs.abstract: From coverage of state-sanctioned killings of drug users in the Philippines to in-depth reports on Venezuela’s economic and social collapse, The New York Times swept the Overseas Press Club’s photography awards.

docs.snippet: At Mississippi State, where roughly 80 students are affected by President Trump’s order, expressions of support for the ban have taken some by surprise.
